extendedIngredients.name: carrot
extendedIngredients.original: ½ carrot (peeled and cut into matchsticks)

extendedIngredients.name: cucumber
extendedIngredients.original: ¼ cucumber (halved lengthways deseeded and cut into matchsticks)
extendedIngredients.originalName: cucumber (halved lengthways deseeded and cut into matchsticks)

extendedIngredients.name: tuna
extendedIngredients.original: 75 grams sashimi-quality tuna fillet (sliced into 3mm x 2cm rectangles)
extendedIngredients.originalName: sashimi-quality tuna fillet (sliced into 3mm x 2cm rectangles)

title: Tuna and Crab and Avocado Wraps
summary: Tunan and Crab and Avocado Wraps is a dairy free and pescatarian recipe with 6 servings. One portion of this dish contains approximately 7g of protein, 6g of fat, and a total of 113 calories. For 62 cents per serving, this recipe covers 8% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 45 minutes. 716 people were glad they tried this recipe. Head to the store and pick up flour tortilla wrap, carrot, sashimi-quality tuna fillet, and a few other things to make it today. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 75%. This score is solid. Try My Emergency Go-To : Tunan Avocado Lettuce Wraps, Mediterranean Tuna Wraps with Fetan and Avocado, and Avocado Tuna Salad Lettuce Wraps for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Tunan on the menu? Try pairing with Merlot, Pinot Noir, and rosé Wine. Though fish is often paired with white wine, 'meatier' fish like tuna can absolutely go with red wine. A Rosé will also pair nicely, particularly if your tunan is prepared with ingredients better suited to a white wine. One wine you could try is Tinga Rio Reserve Merlot. It has 4.8 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 12 dollars.

productMatches.title: Tinga Rio Reserve Merlot
productMatches.description: Ruby red in color with notes of raspberries and strawberries on the nose. Sweet spices came through on the palate from the French and American oak and the palate finishes with soft round tannins. Certified Sustainable and Certified Vegan.

instructions: For the tuna wraps:Whisk together the mayonnaise, wasabi and sesame oil in a small bowl, and paint the tortilla wrap with this mixture on one side.Arrange a row of carrot sticks horizontally 2-3cm /  inch-1 inches up from the bottom of the wrap in front of you.Arrange the cucumber on top of the carrot in the same way, or as best as you can - it may slip down a little.Top with the slices of tuna, also laid horizontally as this makes it easy to wrap up.Roll up the wrap as tightly as you can, starting from the bottom. You want to end up with a shape resembling a fat Cuban cigar.Cut across the rolled wrap diagonally to make 3 pieces.For the crab and avocado wraps:Put the crab meat into a bowl, add the mayonnaise, wasabi paste and oil, and stir to mix.Lay the wrap in front of you and put the crab meat in a horizontal line 2-3cm / 1 inch up from the bottom of the wrap.Take the avocado half, still with skin on, and scoop out the flesh in half-teaspoonful curls, laying these on top of the line of crab meat.Sprinkle the lettuce in a neat line on top of the avocado, and then spritz with the lemon juice.Roll up tightly from the bottom, to form a fat cigar shape and then slice on an angle into three.

steps.step: Whisk together the mayonnaise, wasabi and sesame oil in a small bowl, and paint the tortilla wrap with this mixture on one side.Arrange a row of carrot sticks horizontally 2-3cm /  inch-1 inches up from the bottom of the wrap in front of you.Arrange the cucumber on top of the carrot in the same way, or as best as you can - it may slip down a little.Top with the slices of tuna, also laid horizontally as this makes it easy to wrap up.
Roll up the wrap as tightly as you can, starting from the bottom. You want to end up with a shape resembling a fat Cuban cigar.

analyzedInstructions.name: Cut across the rolled wrap diagonally to make 3 pieces.For the crab and avocado wraps

steps.step: Put the crab meat into a bowl, add the mayonnaise, wasabi paste and oil, and stir to mix.

Lay the wrap in front of you and put the crab meat in a horizontal line 2-3cm / 1 inch up from the bottom of the wrap.Take the avocado half, still with skin on, and scoop out the flesh in half-teaspoonful curls, laying these on top of the line of crab meat.
Sprinkle the lettuce in a neat line on top of the avocado, and then spritz with the lemon juice.
Roll up tightly from the bottom, to form a fat cigar shape and then slice on an angle into three.
